connector.description: Integrate with Consul service discovery and configuration store.

camel.source.endpoint.connectTimeoutMill.name: camel.source.endpoint.connectTimeoutMillis
camel.source.endpoint.connectTimeoutMill.description: Connect timeout for OkHttpClient. Deprecation note: Use connectTimeout instead

camel.source.endpoint.consulClient.name: camel.source.endpoint.consulClient
camel.source.endpoint.consulClient.description: Reference to a com.orbitz.consul.Consul in the registry.

camel.source.endpoint.key.name: camel.source.endpoint.key
camel.source.endpoint.key.description: The default key. Can be overridden by CamelConsulKey

camel.source.endpoint.pingInstance.name: camel.source.endpoint.pingInstance
camel.source.endpoint.pingInstance.description: Configure if the AgentClient should attempt a ping before returning the Consul instance

camel.source.endpoint.readTimeoutMillis.name: camel.source.endpoint.readTimeoutMillis
camel.source.endpoint.readTimeoutMillis.description: Read timeout for OkHttpClient. Deprecation note: Use readTimeout instead

camel.source.endpoint.tags.name: camel.source.endpoint.tags
camel.source.endpoint.tags.description: Set tags. You can separate multiple tags by comma.

camel.source.endpoint.writeTimeoutMillis.name: camel.source.endpoint.writeTimeoutMillis
camel.source.endpoint.writeTimeoutMillis.description: Write timeout for OkHttpClient. Deprecation note: Use writeTimeout instead

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.source.endpoint.consistencyMode.name: camel.source.endpoint.consistencyMode
camel.source.endpoint.consistencyMode.description: The consistencyMode used for queries, default ConsistencyMode.DEFAULT One of: [DEFAULT] [STALE] [CONSISTENT]

camel.source.endpoint.nearNode.name: camel.source.endpoint.nearNode
camel.source.endpoint.nearNode.description: The near node to use for queries.

camel.source.endpoint.nodeMeta.name: camel.source.endpoint.nodeMeta
camel.source.endpoint.nodeMeta.description: The note meta-data to use for queries.

camel.source.endpoint.aclToken.name: camel.source.endpoint.aclToken
camel.source.endpoint.aclToken.description: Sets the ACL token to be used with Consul

camel.source.endpoint.password.name: camel.source.endpoint.password
camel.source.endpoint.password.description: Sets the password to be used for basic authentication

camel.source.endpoint.userName.name: camel.source.endpoint.userName
camel.source.endpoint.userName.description: Sets the username to be used for basic authentication

camel.source.endpoint.blockSeconds.name: camel.source.endpoint.blockSeconds
camel.source.endpoint.blockSeconds.description: The second to wait for a watch event, default 10 seconds

camel.source.endpoint.firstIndex.name: camel.source.endpoint.firstIndex
camel.source.endpoint.firstIndex.description: The first index for watch for, default 0

camel.component.consul.connectTimeoutMil.name: camel.component.consul.connectTimeoutMillis
camel.component.consul.connectTimeoutMil.description: Connect timeout for OkHttpClient. Deprecation note: Use connectTimeout instead

camel.component.consul.consulClient.name: camel.component.consul.consulClient
camel.component.consul.consulClient.description: Reference to a com.orbitz.consul.Consul in the registry.

camel.component.consul.key.name: camel.component.consul.key
camel.component.consul.key.description: The default key. Can be overridden by CamelConsulKey

camel.component.consul.pingInstance.name: camel.component.consul.pingInstance
camel.component.consul.pingInstance.description: Configure if the AgentClient should attempt a ping before returning the Consul instance

camel.component.consul.readTimeoutMillis.name: camel.component.consul.readTimeoutMillis
camel.component.consul.readTimeoutMillis.description: Read timeout for OkHttpClient. Deprecation note: Use readTimeout instead

camel.component.consul.tags.name: camel.component.consul.tags
camel.component.consul.tags.description: Set tags. You can separate multiple tags by comma.

camel.component.consul.writeTimeoutMilli.name: camel.component.consul.writeTimeoutMillis
camel.component.consul.writeTimeoutMilli.description: Write timeout for OkHttpClient. Deprecation note: Use writeTimeout instead

camel.component.consul.bridgeErrorHandle.name: camel.component.consul.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.consul.bridgeErrorHandle.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.consul.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.consul.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.consul.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.consul.consistencyMode.name: camel.component.consul.consistencyMode
camel.component.consul.consistencyMode.description: The consistencyMode used for queries, default ConsistencyMode.DEFAULT One of: [DEFAULT] [STALE] [CONSISTENT]

camel.component.consul.nearNode.name: camel.component.consul.nearNode
camel.component.consul.nearNode.description: The near node to use for queries.

camel.component.consul.nodeMeta.name: camel.component.consul.nodeMeta
camel.component.consul.nodeMeta.description: The note meta-data to use for queries.

camel.component.consul.aclToken.name: camel.component.consul.aclToken
camel.component.consul.aclToken.description: Sets the ACL token to be used with Consul

camel.component.consul.password.name: camel.component.consul.password
camel.component.consul.password.description: Sets the password to be used for basic authentication

camel.component.consul.useGlobalSslConte.name: camel.component.consul.useGlobalSslContextParameters
camel.component.consul.useGlobalSslConte.description: Enable usage of global SSL context parameters.

camel.component.consul.userName.name: camel.component.consul.userName
camel.component.consul.userName.description: Sets the username to be used for basic authentication

camel.component.consul.blockSeconds.name: camel.component.consul.blockSeconds
camel.component.consul.blockSeconds.description: The second to wait for a watch event, default 10 seconds

camel.component.consul.firstIndex.name: camel.component.consul.firstIndex
camel.component.consul.firstIndex.description: The first index for watch for, default 0
